steps.detail: Follow the setup instructions for MWS and SWS.
Log in with the username 'NoPileUps' and password 'N0PileUp$'.
Change the computer description. Go to Control Panel -> System -> Change Settings -> System Properties.
Install Bomgar. Insert the USB, then run 'Bomgar Install-NPU.bat' as an administrator.
Verify the setup. Turn on Bomgar on your laptop, go to My Jump Group, and search for the locator name.
Edit the Jump Client as needed.
Turn on the CPU. Follow the Set Up Sheet to configure the computer.
Wait for the computer to start up. Navigate to the 'Finish Install' folder and run 'Install SW USB' as admin (do not reboot).
Plug in the SSD, install the correct SW version, and then run the finalize process.
Label the device.
For MWS, after setup, open Internet Explorer, go to sitewatch.cloud, add it to favorites, and drag the icon to the desktop.
Need to double check with ADAM in change swadmin username and pwd
Plug in the router. Network cable from Setup PC into X0, and WAN network in X1.
Wait for the router to power on. Use your laptop, open Bomgar, log in, navigate to the 'Warehouse' group, and select the router.
Open a web browser and go to 192.168.168.168. Use the login name 'admin' and the password 'password'. If it prompts, change the password to 'Password'.
Navigate to Device > Settings > Firmware and Settings > Upload Firmware. Select the firmware file from the 'TZ-270' folder (Note: The firmware file should have a *.bin.sig extension).
Let the firmware install automatically. Ignore any warnings. Once completed, the router will restart itself.

Log back in to the browser 192.168.168.168. Navigate to Device > Settings > Firmware and Settings. Click Import/Export Configuration. Select Import Configuration. Navigate to the TZ270 folder. Choose the right version. Click Import. Ignore the 'Network Error'.
Verify Configuration. Open a web browser and go to 192.168.100.1. Use the login name 'admin' and the password 'Password'.
Navigate to Device > Settings > Administration, change Administrator Login Name to swadmin, and password is Router Password which is store in clientel
Browse back to 192.168.100.1, and try to login with swadmin and pwd for double check -> Done
Plug in the CPU and connect all necessary peripherals, such as the monitor, keyboard, and mouse.
Power on the CPU. As the system starts, press the 'DEL' key on the keyboard to enter the BIOS setup utility.
In the BIOS menu, navigate to the 'Boot' tab using the arrow keys. Set 'Boot Option #1' to the UEFI: Generic Flash Drive (or the name of your bootable device).
Save the changes and exit the BIOS. The system will reboot automatically.
Wait for the operating system installation to complete. The system will restart, and the 'Set Up Computer' window will appear.

Follow IMAGING step, but choosing the option for OTT setup. Make sure to use the correct Image - "\\swimage\\Images\\Tools\\BootMedia\\USB_Images\\BIO\\Faytech N4200". Enter 15 or 21 depending on the size of OTT when it prompts during the install process.
Install the latest touchscreen controller firmware if setting up one of the following terminals.
21.5" REV B N4200 OTT and is located in N:\\Development\\HDI\\Driver\\OTT\\FT214200\\REV B T04.
21.5" REV C N4200 OTT and is located in N:\\Development\\HDI\\Driver\\OTT\\FT214200\\REV C T04.
Open GalaxUpdate2.exe.
REV B - PCAP80H84...Faytech...H84 in REV B folder, and the other one in the REV C folder.
Start Firmware Update -> Done.
Restart the OTT, and follow the step on Finalize folder which is show on the screen.
Wait for an update
Follow the setup instructions for MWS and SWS.
Log in with the username 'NoPileUps' and password 'N0PileUp$'.
Change the computer description. Go to Control Panel -> System -> Change Settings -> System Properties.
Install Bomgar. Insert the USB, then run 'Bomgar Install-NPU.bat' as an administrator.
Verify the setup. Turn on Bomgar on your laptop, go to My Jump Group, and search for the locator name.
Edit the Jump Client as needed.
